metadata.feature_description: Monitors and reports Active Directory connection status and availability

steps.action: Logged in as superuser (host) and navigated to Settings > Extensions
steps.actual: Extensions page loaded successfully with list of installed extensions

steps.action: Filtered extensions by 'Authentication Systems' and clicked on DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication
steps.expected: AD authentication extension settings should open
steps.actual: AD authentication extension settings panel opened with tabs including Site Settings

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test Network Status with Unreachable Domain Controller

steps.action: Navigated to Site Settings tab and enabled AD authentication (checked 'Enabled?' checkbox)
Clicked 'Update Authentication Settings' button to trigger network status check
steps.expected: Network status should be displayed showing connection attempt results
steps.actual: Red error banner appeared displaying connection failure: 'Error: is currently unavailable. DotNetNuke.Services.Exceptions.ModuleLoadException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object...' - This correctly indicates the AD connection failed because no domain controller is configured/reachable

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Status Updates After Configuration Changes

steps.action: Unchecked 'Enabled?' checkbox to disable AD authentication

steps.expected: No network status message should appear when AD is disabled
steps.actual: Settings saved without network status message - clean form displayed with no error banner. This confirms status check only runs when AD is enabled.

observations: The Network Status Monitoring feature works as designed - it checks AD connectivity when authentication is enabled and displays status results
Status reporting includes checks for: Global Catalog Status, Root Domain Status, LDAP Status, and Network Domains Status (as evidenced by code review of ADSIProvider.GetNetworkStatus())
When AD authentication is disabled, no network status check occurs (expected behavior per code in Settings.ascx.cs lines 166-170)
Error messages are displayed in red banner format, while success messages would appear in green (per code lines 209-216)
Test with valid AD connection and LDAP status verification could not be performed as no Active Directory environment is available in the test environment
Error message localization is implemented in the code (LocalizedStatus method in Settings.ascx.cs) but could not be tested without additional language packs
